"Leroy!"

My head snapped back to hear the source of the voice and my whole body instantly started vibrating with chills. My skin flushed and a strong unknown emotion washed over me. I started to feel warm all over and a tingling sensation blossomed in my stomach.

What the heck is happening to me?

As soon as I met midnight blue eyes, my whole being froze- literally. I had no idea why but I was transfixed by those eyes. So many emotions went through me but I couldn't even decipher what they meant. Right now, all I could see were those eyes who were helding me captive against my own will.

"Ughreg," a grunt was heard right below me.

The blue mysterious eyes immediately broke off the spell by glancing at the bloody boy. I slowly blinked before registering my surroundings. Oh my god! What the heck happened?! I can't believe I just openly stared at some guy!

Shaking my head in disbelief, I straightened myself up and turned to Leroy sprawled on the floor.

"Here," I stuck out my hand reluctantly. His eyes widened in horror and he withdrew even further. Rolling my eyes, I grabbed one of his hands and pulled him up effortlessly.

I then released his hand as quickly as I had taken it and turned around. My time was up, it was next to three a.m in the morning and I had to go to the grocery to buy Mia some breakfast.

"Wait! I recognize u!"

I whirled around and saw one of the bad boys pointing at me with an accusing finger. What did he mean by he recognized me?!

"You're from Riverhigh school like us right?" He whispered but I had heard perfectly well. I clenched my fists and vigorously shook my head.

"No-"

"Yes! I saw you once with that hood! I knew you were familiar!" He gasped, interrupting me. Panick rose into me as I shook my head again. No, no, no, no!

By now all the other boys were looking at me- especially Leroy who was scrutinizing me while holding his bloody nose. My mind racing at a hundred miles per hour, I spun around, grabbed my gained money from the announcer and leapt out of the ring.

"Hey!" The guy screamed but I had already disappeared in the crowd of people. I twisted myself back to the bouncer and with just one glare, the door had already opened. I burst out into the fresh night air and ran to my bike.

And just like that, I hopped on my bike and rode off away from those Bad boys who could easily blow off my cover.

"6 dollars," the gruff man said. I stuffed through my well earned money. I slapped a ten dollar bill on the counter and received change before grabbing the stuff and walking out of the grocery shop.

I then attached the plastic bags to my bike before driving back to the only place I could call home. By the time I was walking up the apartment stairs, the sun was already peeking out from behind the clouds.

I am forced to budget carefully. I am only a high school student, orphaned and responsible for raising my younger sister, Mia. Without any income, I must attend school and make ends meet by renting a decrepit apartment and earning a small wage through nighttime boxing matches.

And now I have another trouble - those bad boys know what I'm up to at night. I can only pray they won't recognize me.

Now it is already dawn. I hastily prepared a breakfast, placated my lovely little sister, and escorted her to kindergarten. Then I repositioned myself on my motorbike before riding down the road. 

I walked down the hall, my head down and my movements brisk. I kept on looking around me for fear that one of the Bad Boys would see me and blow off my cover. All the teenagers that were currently bustling around me, looked right past me as if I didn't even exist....and that was perfectly fine with me.

I paused once I arrived in front of my classroom. Hesitating between entering or skipping class because I was so tired. Sighing, I walked into the empty class and sat at my usual seat: which was found completely at the back.

I didn't even bother waiting for the pupils or the teacher as I layed my head on the desk and let a well needed sleep envelop me.

"Ma, where are you and Pa going?" I frowned in disappointment as mom put on her favorite coat.

"Aw, Hayley. Don't worry, Pa and I are only going out for dinner. I mean it's Valentine's day!" She grinned in excitement and gave me a hug. I couldn't help but give a little smile too. I had really wanted my parents stay today but I didn't want to stop their happiness either.

I liked seeing them united and so in love with each other.

"There's pizza in the microwave and for once I'll let you and your sister drink soda," Pa chuckled. A that precise moment, a small ball of hair appeared running towards us.

"Thou called me faddy?" Mia showed her two lost front teeth.

"How many times have I told you not to run in the house? You can fall and get hurt!" Mom scolded her.

"Wherth are ou foing?" she ignored Mom and asked. I nearly swooned at the cuteness of it all.

"Pa and ma are going to have dinner," I said while picking her up in my arms.

"Can I come?" Mia shrieked while clapping her hands happily.

"Sorry but not this time, sweetie," Pa sighed as Mia's face fell.

"Cheer up, Mia. We're going to have fun too! How about yo go prepare the movie 'Tangles' while I bid ma and Pa goodbye?" I smiled as my little sister sprung back to life. She hopped out of my grasp and ran to the TV.

Shaking my head in amusement, I turned back to my parents.

"You'll be alright?" Ma asked.

"Of course, I'm seventeen," I protested.

"Okay, okay, we'll be going now," she hooked her arm with my pa's before blowing a kiss at me.

"Love you, Ma. Love you, Pa. And be careful," I waved at them as they headed for the car.

"We will!" Pa said and he drove off.

I closed the door and turned back to join Mia-

"MRS. HOODS!"

I instantly jolted out of my sleep. It took me some seconds to adjust to my blurred surroundings. As soon as I saw myself in a classroom, I abruptly lifted my head up and there stood a very angry looking Mr. Porks.

"I've been calling you FOUR times, young lady! I would have given you a detention if the bell hadn't rung so consider yourself lucky," he squawked. I pretended to be scared and without a word, I scurried out of my seat, grabbed my bag and rushed out of the empty classroom. Phew, that pig of a man.

I headed for the cafeteria with my bag carelessly slung over my shoulder but then abruptly stopped in front of the cafeteria doors. The badboys always arrived 'fashionably late' at the cafeteria so if I quickly took my food and got out of there, they wouldn't see me.

I slipped through the doors and speed walked to the lunch lady.

"Takeaway please," I said in a gruff voice. She wordlessly plopped some sloppy mashed potatoes and meatballs in a paper bag and handed it to me. I refrained from cringing at the sight and turned around to get out of there but luck wasn't on my side today.

I smashed against a solid body and all the food splattered on my BEST jacket. I slowly lowered my head to look at my spoiled clothes. My eye involuntarily twitched- which meant that I was ready to throw a flying punch at the bast*rd who did that. Gripping the paper bag, I tried to calm myself down because I was in a cafeteria which meant that I couldn't make a scene without gaining unwanted attention.

"Sorry," the guy said.

My whole body froze as familiar chills ran down my spine.

Oh no.

My eyes widened in shock and horror. Could I be more unlucky?! I ducked my head even more and clutched the paper bag in my hand tighter.

What should I do know? I was already cornered! My head swam in complete panic- they're going to find out that I'm the underground girl and surely they'll be angry that I hit Leroy and then they'll blackmail me and make me do things I didn't want to do in exchange-

"You alright?"

I was pulled out of my reverie when the guy put his hands on my shoulder. My whole body jolted as a zap of electricity coursed through my body

My instant reaction was pulling away as quickly as possible from the guy. I nearly tripped over my feet as I stumbled out of the cafeteria.

"Hey! That's the girl from yesterday! Catch her!" I heard another guy shout from the cafeteria. His words made my mind switch back to my normal mode.

I sprinted down the hall and towards the school doors. I could already hear the heavy footsteps not far behind me. Gosh! How could they run so fast?!

I threw open the doors and staggered to my bike. Throwing one last glance behind me to see all of them guys a meter away, I pressed on the pedal and the bike lurched forward full speed. Go, go, go! I mentally screamed as my bike sped down the road.

I kept on driving until I was sure that I was a good 3 miles away. Finally stopping in a random park, I got off my bike and dropped onto a bench in exhaustion and anger. The adrenaline quickly fading away and my mind whirling around a tornade of thoughts, I held my head in my hands. Before I could stop myself, I was falling into a deep dark tunnel.

My last thought before falling asleep was:

Those bast*rds, they couldn't have at least let me have my food!

"When is she going to wake up?" Leroy's voice filled the room.

"I don't know, but I seriously hope that she doesn't wake up until the other guys come!" An unknown voice replied.

"Yeah, gosh, what if she attacked us?!"

"We're definitely doomed if that happened..."

"Yeah...is she awake yet?"

"No,"

"How about now?"

"No."

"...now?"

"NO! GODDAMNIT SHE'S NOT AWAKE YET!"

"WILL YOU TWO SHUT UP!" I suddenly screamed. Urgh what's all this racket about!? I rubbed my eyes until it adjusted to my surroundings. As soon as I realized that I was in an unfamiliar place, I leapt up. Before they could react, I was sprinting towards the door.

Just as I reached for the knob, the door flew open. My eyes flew wide and I froze as three more guys appeared. I spun my head around to see that Leroy and the other guy (whom I think was called Ty) had already recovered and were standing right behind me.

I was trapped.

My eyes darted everywhere for a possible escape but in vain.

"Don't even try," one of them said. Chills ran up and down my spine at his voice. I slowly raised my head up to stare at the familiar midnight blue eyes. It was him. It was him who made me feel those things. It was him the root of my new problems!

"What do you want?" I said in a deathly voice although I was shaking in anger inside. If I blew up right then and now, I wouldn't get the answers I wanted and more problems would arise. I definitely had enough problems as it was, there was no need for me to have some more.

The whole room remained silent as I shot daggers at him but he didn't reply- he just stared.

"ANSWER!" I barked, my whole composure flying out of the window. They all jumped...all except him. His reaction surprised and pleased me: he was now fuming and boy was that hot. His dark hair was wildly unkempt and a few stray locks fell across his forehead right above his blazing blue eyes.

"Do not talk to me like that! I am your alph-" He was cut off when Ty slapped his head. He glared at Ty before turning back to me.

"You're my what?! My a*s?!" I snapped as I took a step closer and poked him hard in the ch*st. By now I was practically nose to nose with him and I could feel the electricity zapping and crackling between us. We were both shooting daggers at each other.

His body shook in anger as he growled, "How DARE you disrespect your alph-"

"-NOW NOW CHILDREN! CAN WE PLEASE CALM DOWN!" Leroy suddenly sang. Both of our heads snapped to him, resulting in the bumping of our heads.

"OUCH!" We screamed as our hands flew to our foreheads in sync. I rubbed my head and glared at him just as he did to me.

"You sick bast*rd!" I screamed- intense rage running through my veins.

"WHAT DO YOU MEAN BY SICK BAST*RD?!" He screamed back.

"WHAT DO YOU MEAN BY WHAT DO YOU MEAN BY SICK BAST*RD?! ARE YOU TOO STUPID TO UNDERSTAND OR DID I BUMP YOUR HEAD TO HARD?!" I yelled.

"You little rat-" he snarled and lifted his leg to take a step forward but this time not only did Ty slap a hand on his mouth but all the other guys helped to hold him back.

I took this as an opportunity to sprint for the door but a hand shot out and snatched my ankle. I went flailing into the air but suddenly my wrist was pulled on and I ended up crashing into a hard ch*st.

My breath wheezed out of my lungs at the impact.

"Are you alright?" A soft concerned voice asked.

Goosebumps rose on my body at the sound and feel of his strong arms around me.

I instantly snapped out of my daydream and pushed my elbow into his ribs. With a hiss he loosened his grip on me. I jumped a mile away and whipped my head around to glare at him. A flash of emotion went through his midnight blue eyes and disappeared just as fast as it came.

Shaking my head I cleared the absurd idea that he was feeling hurt. HA! Like he*l- I'm going crazy. It must have been anger he was feeling.

Straightening my back I snapped, "Don't. Touch. Me."

He scoffed, his lips drawing into a sneer, "You're the one who crashed into me like a big fat a*s elephant."

"What. Did. You. Just. Call. Me?!" I felt the anger build up in me once more.

"Oh, so not only are you fat but you're also deaf as a stick. It's obvious you're useless as f*ck, why were you even born-"

"-Blake!" Leroy and Ty cried out in unison.

My eyes widened in shock  as I froze and I was so thankful that my hood was covering my face.

You're a useless piece of sh*t who doesn't even deserve to be born! Why did I even give birth to you when you're just worthless! You don't deserve to live! You're NOTHING! NOTHING!

The sentence whirled around my head again and again- its words crashing onto me like it had never done before.

"Leroy!"

My head snapped back to hear the source of the voice and my whole body instantly started vibrating with chills. My skin flushed and a strong unknown emotion washed over me. I started to feel warm all over and a tingling sensation blossomed in my stomach.

What the heck is happening to me?

As soon as I met midnight blue eyes, my whole being froze- literally. I had no idea why but I was transfixed by those eyes. So many emotions went through me but I couldn't even decipher what they meant. Right now, all I could see were those eyes who were helding me captive against my own will.

"Ughreg," a grunt was heard right below me.

The blue mysterious eyes immediately broke off the spell by glancing at the bloody boy. I slowly blinked before registering my surroundings. Oh my god! What the heck happened?! I can't believe I just openly stared at some guy!

Shaking my head in disbelief, I straightened myself up and turned to Leroy sprawled on the floor.

"Here," I stuck out my hand reluctantly. His eyes widened in horror and he withdrew even further. Rolling my eyes, I grabbed one of his hands and pulled him up effortlessly.

I then released his hand as quickly as I had taken it and turned around. My time was up, it was next to three a.m in the morning and I had to go to the grocery to buy Mia some breakfast.

"Wait! I recognize u!"

I whirled around and saw one of the bad boys pointing at me with an accusing finger. What did he mean by he recognized me?!

"You're from Riverhigh school like us right?" He whispered but I had heard perfectly well. I clenched my fists and vigorously shook my head.

"No-"

"Yes! I saw you once with that hood! I knew you were familiar!" He gasped, interrupting me. Panick rose into me as I shook my head again. No, no, no, no!

By now all the other boys were looking at me- especially Leroy who was scrutinizing me while holding his bloody nose. My mind racing at a hundred miles per hour, I spun around, grabbed my gained money from the announcer and leapt out of the ring.

"Hey!" The guy screamed but I had already disappeared in the crowd of people. I twisted myself back to the bouncer and with just one glare, the door had already opened. I burst out into the fresh night air and ran to my bike.

And just like that, I hopped on my bike and rode off away from those Bad boys who could easily blow off my cover.

"6 dollars," the gruff man said. I stuffed through my well earned money. I slapped a ten dollar bill on the counter and received change before grabbing the stuff and walking out of the grocery shop.

I then attached the plastic bags to my bike before driving back to the only place I could call home. By the time I was walking up the apartment stairs, the sun was already peeking out from behind the clouds.

I am forced to budget carefully. I am only a high school student, orphaned and responsible for raising my younger sister, Mia. Without any income, I must attend school and make ends meet by renting a decrepit apartment and earning a small wage through nighttime boxing matches.

And now I have another trouble - those bad boys know what I'm up to at night. I can only pray they won't recognize me.

Now it is already dawn. I hastily prepared a breakfast, placated my lovely little sister, and escorted her to kindergarten. Then I repositioned myself on my motorbike before riding down the road. 

I walked down the hall, my head down and my movements brisk. I kept on looking around me for fear that one of the Bad Boys would see me and blow off my cover. All the teenagers that were currently bustling around me, looked right past me as if I didn't even exist....and that was perfectly fine with me.

I paused once I arrived in front of my classroom. Hesitating between entering or skipping class because I was so tired. Sighing, I walked into the empty class and sat at my usual seat: which was found completely at the back.

I didn't even bother waiting for the pupils or the teacher as I layed my head on the desk and let a well needed sleep envelop me.

"Ma, where are you and Pa going?" I frowned in disappointment as mom put on her favorite coat.

"Aw, Hayley. Don't worry, Pa and I are only going out for dinner. I mean it's Valentine's day!" She grinned in excitement and gave me a hug. I couldn't help but give a little smile too. I had really wanted my parents stay today but I didn't want to stop their happiness either.

I liked seeing them united and so in love with each other.

"There's pizza in the microwave and for once I'll let you and your sister drink soda," Pa chuckled. A that precise moment, a small ball of hair appeared running towards us.

"Thou called me faddy?" Mia showed her two lost front teeth.

"How many times have I told you not to run in the house? You can fall and get hurt!" Mom scolded her.

"Wherth are ou foing?" she ignored Mom and asked. I nearly swooned at the cuteness of it all.

"Pa and ma are going to have dinner," I said while picking her up in my arms.

"Can I come?" Mia shrieked while clapping her hands happily.

"Sorry but not this time, sweetie," Pa sighed as Mia's face fell.

"Cheer up, Mia. We're going to have fun too! How about yo go prepare the movie 'Tangles' while I bid ma and Pa goodbye?" I smiled as my little sister sprung back to life. She hopped out of my grasp and ran to the TV.

Shaking my head in amusement, I turned back to my parents.

"You'll be alright?" Ma asked.

"Of course, I'm seventeen," I protested.

"Okay, okay, we'll be going now," she hooked her arm with my pa's before blowing a kiss at me.

"Love you, Ma. Love you, Pa. And be careful," I waved at them as they headed for the car.

"We will!" Pa said and he drove off.

I closed the door and turned back to join Mia-

"MRS. HOODS!"

I instantly jolted out of my sleep. It took me some seconds to adjust to my blurred surroundings. As soon as I saw myself in a classroom, I abruptly lifted my head up and there stood a very angry looking Mr. Porks.

"I've been calling you FOUR times, young lady! I would have given you a detention if the bell hadn't rung so consider yourself lucky," he squawked. I pretended to be scared and without a word, I scurried out of my seat, grabbed my bag and rushed out of the empty classroom. Phew, that pig of a man.

I headed for the cafeteria with my bag carelessly slung over my shoulder but then abruptly stopped in front of the cafeteria doors. The badboys always arrived 'fashionably late' at the cafeteria so if I quickly took my food and got out of there, they wouldn't see me.

I slipped through the doors and speed walked to the lunch lady.

"Takeaway please," I said in a gruff voice. She wordlessly plopped some sloppy mashed potatoes and meatballs in a paper bag and handed it to me. I refrained from cringing at the sight and turned around to get out of there but luck wasn't on my side today.

I smashed against a solid body and all the food splattered on my BEST jacket. I slowly lowered my head to look at my spoiled clothes. My eye involuntarily twitched- which meant that I was ready to throw a flying punch at the bast*rd who did that. Gripping the paper bag, I tried to calm myself down because I was in a cafeteria which meant that I couldn't make a scene without gaining unwanted attention.

"Sorry," the guy said.

My whole body froze as familiar chills ran down my spine.

Oh no.

My eyes widened in shock and horror. Could I be more unlucky?! I ducked my head even more and clutched the paper bag in my hand tighter.

What should I do know? I was already cornered! My head swam in complete panic- they're going to find out that I'm the underground girl and surely they'll be angry that I hit Leroy and then they'll blackmail me and make me do things I didn't want to do in exchange-

"You alright?"

I was pulled out of my reverie when the guy put his hands on my shoulder. My whole body jolted as a zap of electricity coursed through my body

My instant reaction was pulling away as quickly as possible from the guy. I nearly tripped over my feet as I stumbled out of the cafeteria.

"Hey! That's the girl from yesterday! Catch her!" I heard another guy shout from the cafeteria. His words made my mind switch back to my normal mode.

I sprinted down the hall and towards the school doors. I could already hear the heavy footsteps not far behind me. Gosh! How could they run so fast?!

I threw open the doors and staggered to my bike. Throwing one last glance behind me to see all of them guys a meter away, I pressed on the pedal and the bike lurched forward full speed. Go, go, go! I mentally screamed as my bike sped down the road.

I kept on driving until I was sure that I was a good 3 miles away. Finally stopping in a random park, I got off my bike and dropped onto a bench in exhaustion and anger. The adrenaline quickly fading away and my mind whirling around a tornade of thoughts, I held my head in my hands. Before I could stop myself, I was falling into a deep dark tunnel.

My last thought before falling asleep was:

Those bast*rds, they couldn't have at least let me have my food!

"When is she going to wake up?" Leroy's voice filled the room.

"I don't know, but I seriously hope that she doesn't wake up until the other guys come!" An unknown voice replied.

"Yeah, gosh, what if she attacked us?!"

"We're definitely doomed if that happened..."

"Yeah...is she awake yet?"

"No,"

"How about now?"

"No."

"...now?"

"NO! GODDAMNIT SHE'S NOT AWAKE YET!"

"WILL YOU TWO SHUT UP!" I suddenly screamed. Urgh what's all this racket about!? I rubbed my eyes until it adjusted to my surroundings. As soon as I realized that I was in an unfamiliar place, I leapt up. Before they could react, I was sprinting towards the door.

Just as I reached for the knob, the door flew open. My eyes flew wide and I froze as three more guys appeared. I spun my head around to see that Leroy and the other guy (whom I think was called Ty) had already recovered and were standing right behind me.

I was trapped.

My eyes darted everywhere for a possible escape but in vain.

"Don't even try," one of them said. Chills ran up and down my spine at his voice. I slowly raised my head up to stare at the familiar midnight blue eyes. It was him. It was him who made me feel those things. It was him the root of my new problems!

"What do you want?" I said in a deathly voice although I was shaking in anger inside. If I blew up right then and now, I wouldn't get the answers I wanted and more problems would arise. I definitely had enough problems as it was, there was no need for me to have some more.

The whole room remained silent as I shot daggers at him but he didn't reply- he just stared.

"ANSWER!" I barked, my whole composure flying out of the window. They all jumped...all except him. His reaction surprised and pleased me: he was now fuming and boy was that hot. His dark hair was wildly unkempt and a few stray locks fell across his forehead right above his blazing blue eyes.

"Do not talk to me like that! I am your alph-" He was cut off when Ty slapped his head. He glared at Ty before turning back to me.

"You're my what?! My a*s?!" I snapped as I took a step closer and poked him hard in the ch*st. By now I was practically nose to nose with him and I could feel the electricity zapping and crackling between us. We were both shooting daggers at each other.

His body shook in anger as he growled, "How DARE you disrespect your alph-"

"-NOW NOW CHILDREN! CAN WE PLEASE CALM DOWN!" Leroy suddenly sang. Both of our heads snapped to him, resulting in the bumping of our heads.

"OUCH!" We screamed as our hands flew to our foreheads in sync. I rubbed my head and glared at him just as he did to me.

"You sick bast*rd!" I screamed- intense rage running through my veins.

"WHAT DO YOU MEAN BY SICK BAST*RD?!" He screamed back.

"WHAT DO YOU MEAN BY WHAT DO YOU MEAN BY SICK BAST*RD?! ARE YOU TOO STUPID TO UNDERSTAND OR DID I BUMP YOUR HEAD TO HARD?!" I yelled.

"You little rat-" he snarled and lifted his leg to take a step forward but this time not only did Ty slap a hand on his mouth but all the other guys helped to hold him back.

I took this as an opportunity to sprint for the door but a hand shot out and snatched my ankle. I went flailing into the air but suddenly my wrist was pulled on and I ended up crashing into a hard ch*st.

My breath wheezed out of my lungs at the impact.

"Are you alright?" A soft concerned voice asked.

Goosebumps rose on my body at the sound and feel of his strong arms around me.

I instantly snapped out of my daydream and pushed my elbow into his ribs. With a hiss he loosened his grip on me. I jumped a mile away and whipped my head around to glare at him. A flash of emotion went through his midnight blue eyes and disappeared just as fast as it came.

Shaking my head I cleared the absurd idea that he was feeling hurt. HA! Like he*l- I'm going crazy. It must have been anger he was feeling.

Straightening my back I snapped, "Don't. Touch. Me."

He scoffed, his lips drawing into a sneer, "You're the one who crashed into me like a big fat a*s elephant."

"Oh, so not only are you fat but you're also deaf as a stick. It's obvious you're useless as f*ck, why were you even born-"
